# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10) = join(split(text, "\n\r"), " \n") |> split("\n\r") |> map(x -> wrap_line(x, text_width))

@test begin
    line = ["a", "very", "long", "sentence", "that", "cannot", "fit", "into", "the", "line"]
    wrap_string(join(line, " ")) == ["a very long", "sentence that", "cannot fit into", "the line"]
